definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]

sentences.english: Look at the bar and look at the wire.
It's a simple solid-silver piece at the end of that cord necklace.
sentences.chinese: 这只不过是一根普通的带有银质吊坠的吊绳项链。

sentences.english: Pre-registration visitors could receive license cover and sling there.
sentences.chinese: 预登记持卡观众可在此领取证件套及吊绳。

sentences.english: The rig tong counter-balance line must be inspected at a regular interval.
sentences.chinese: 必须定期检查大钳平衡铊的吊绳。

sentences.english: Rig tong line pulley and counterbalances must be inspected at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 必须定期检查大钳吊绳的滑轮和平衡铊。

sentences.english: L. The rig tong counterbalance line must be inspected at a regular interval.
sentences.chinese: 必须定期检查大钳平衡铊的吊绳。

definition: rope tackle hanging from a mast/crow foot (system of ropes through tackle to hold up an awning)
a boom (i.e. transverse beam for hanging objects)
